III.i.1.B.1.a
.
Requirement for a Minimum Period of Active Duty
The minimum active duty service requirement of
38 CFR 3.12a(a)(1)
must be met, in accordance with
38 U.S.C. 5303A
, by all persons, including officers, who
originally enlisted in a regular component of the Armed Forces after September 7, 1980,
or
entered on active duty after October 16, 1981,
and
have not
previously completed a continuous period of active duty of at least 24 months, nor
been discharged or released from active duty under
10 U.S.C. 1171
.
Important
:  A Veteran may meet the minimum period of active duty without completing 24 months of active duty.
38 CFR 3.12a(a)(1)
defines the minimum period as
24 months of continuous active duty, or
the full period for which a person is called or ordered to active duty.
Note
:  In the case of a delayed enlistment, the entry date for purposes of this provision is the date of entry on active duty, not the date of swearing in, which may have preceded actual entry into active duty.
